reviews.text: Acre is a gem in Greenpoint's budding "Little Tokyo" sceneâ€”a cozy, Japanese-owned cafe and lunch counter that's equal parts coffee shop, bento box haven, and chill hangout. If you're craving balanced, health-conscious Japanese comfort food without the fuss, this spot nails it.

Lovely food. Had chicken karaage bento, pork katsu bento, salmon bento and matcha latte - all excellent.
Itâ€™s a delicious Japanese homemade food. Itâ€™s always a nice ambiance at backyard. And interesting ceramic items from Japan.
Came here on a whim after some shopping and loved it! The food was so good - was skeptical at first because I wasnâ€™t familiar with some of the items but everything was delicious, hot and fresh.
Very polite, very patient, very attentive + yummy food
I was really excited to go here because soy garlic chicken is one of my favorites, but this one wasnâ€™t even really coated with any sauce. Like it was all right, but I definitely had way better.
lines can get long, but it moves pretty fast. all the food is great and I highly recommend pairing your meal with the coffee panna cotta. chefs kiss.
The bento box was very good! Loved everything about this place, I just wish it was a little cheaper.
Love the egg salad sandwich (with gluten free bread) and gluten free muffins! So many amazing gluten free options!

Great spot for a simple coffee/matcha and a pastry or an awesome meal. The food is so flavorful and simple at the same time. I highly recommend this spot if youâ€™re in the area. The atmosphere is very chill

One of the best karaage I ever had! Really enjoyed Pork Katsu Bento Box too. Only thing I wouldnâ€™t order again is Japanese Egg Sandwich. It wasnâ€™t bad and was still tasty but I wouldnâ€™t say this is an authentic presentation of Japanese egg sandwich.
The food's awesome, and the vibe is super chill. You should totally check this place out.

I tried this place in 2023 so this review is late but I would jump on a plane right now to Brooklyn to dine at Acre again. It wasnâ€™t on my itinerary to come here but I was getting  hungry and came across this place so I decided to give it a shot. I ordered the chicken karage sandwich with a side edamame salad. I also ordered a tea but donâ€™t remember what it was. It was a bit of wait but it was so worth it. The chicken was so juicy and crispy and the salad was refreshing. I walked out very satiated. Acre will definitely me on the itinerary next time I visit Brooklyn.

This place is a vibe. From the first moment you enter they have Japanese merchandises on display and then the counter to order. It was my first time ordering and the staff helped me pick my options. My order was ready in 5 minutes, they are clean and the kitchen opens up to the seating area and you dont have any cooking smell. I will be back and recommend trying it if you are in the area.
The bento box, while pricey, is very delicious. I had the salmon bento box. And the vegan chocolate chip cookie is perfection!
Tried the kara age, delicious.  The wait to get a drink is too long
I love their Japanese-style lunch box. Very authentic. The fried chicken tastes very good!
Mango matcha LattÃ© is an excellent combination especially when made by Reo. Plain iced Houjicha also great ğŸ‘ canâ€™t wait to try the food next time
The food was amazing. We had to wait a minute in the line for it but weâ€™ve managed to find a table and the service was great. Really unique flavours and drinks would recommend
Great neighborhood hangout â€¦ yummy food, great products, and super friendly service
This is it! ğŸ‘ğŸ¼â¤ï¸

We tried the avocado sandwich, chicken sandwich, and salmon plate. Everything was really good!! Interesting flavors that went together well and all ingredients were fresh. They know what they're doing in this kitchen. Two thumbs up!!
Great coffee shop in the neighborhood!!!! The miso soup is incredible (and not what you'd expect)
Best bento box in city

Acre is absolutely delicious. The chicken sandwich is fresh and flavorful (try it with a matcha latte). Also, find a table in the back patio for some fresh air dining. The wait time is never very long for food, and the staff is kind. This is a great spot for brunch or lunch in Greenpoint. You will be glad you paid the visit!

Food quality is good
Basically self-service
Atmosphere would be great if it is not very busy. Seats are compacted to each other, so you can easily hear what other tables discuss about. Not a place if you want to have a more quiet space.

I ordered salmon, chicken and salad. All of them taste good but a bit pricy.

Love this spot! Iâ€™ve lived in Greenpoint for many years and Iâ€™ve seen it changing slowly into little Tokyo, which Iâ€™m so happy about. Iâ€™m absolutely in love with Japanese culture and food and this spot is excellent! Delicious Bento box and lots of veg options. Highly recommended.
Chicken Nanban Bento is so amazing! Just so amazing 10/10!
Amazing place for bento. Cool vibe and has a cafe with unique menu. Definitely a place to check out.

Great Japanese bento place. We had to wait a little, but it was Saturday around 1pm. You can enjoy the Japanese goods they sell while waiting. The food was pretty good and staff are nice.  I like the fact that they served black rice instead of white rice on the side.
Matcha Latte is exquisite.ğŸ’š
i love their food and drinks! just wish it wasnâ€™t as popular because of the wait but it deserves all the love<3
Beautiful place. Have only had the food from the cafe but it is absolutely delicious every time. Peaceful garden out the back to work in, but FYI there is no WiFi.
Amazing chicken karaage and nanban bentos! The hojicha latte was one of the best Iâ€™ve had.
Food was good. It took 20 min to serve the bento box, which could be improved.

ACRE is a cozy gem in Williamsburg perfect for a relaxed brunch with a Japanese twistâ€”think egg salad on brioche, crispy chicken karaage, and fragrant hojicha lattes. The airy, minimalist space with garden seating adds to the charm, and the staff is warm and attentive. Itâ€™s slightly pricier than your average cafÃ©, but the quality and atmosphere make it well worth it. Great spot for slow mornings, casual catch-ups, or a solo coffee with your book.

Agree with the others on the pricing, but honestly thatâ€™s most of New York. I do think the iPad/tip thing was bizarre. Had the same experience where they stared me down as I added tip. But we buss our own tables and pick up our own food? Maybe this is a commentary on tipping culture in general as I know itâ€™s not unique to acre, but it definitely put a damper on the experience.

Party of 5. Went on a rainy Sunday and the line was at the door. Very popular place. Surprisingly we got a table after we ordered. It's a first come first order to get a table.

For drinks, honey yuzu and hochicha were very good, ğŸ‘. Ordered pesto avocado sandwich, pork katsu bento, chicken curry bento, vinegar fried chicken bento box, and the salmon bento box. All were good but salmon was our least favorite. Came with salad, brussel sprouts, black (purple colored) rice, and pickled radishes. Portion size is good for breakfast. Not heavy.

Service was nice. It's not a fancy restaurant but a rustic Japanese coffee breakfast shop. Would come again.
the food and drinks were delish & the staff were so kind! i accidentally spilled my drink after having only one sip and the barista kindly remade my drink ğŸ¥¹ğŸ«¶ğŸ¼
incredible food with a lovely back garden. counter service thatâ€™s fast and efficient
Food was great and very fresh and fast
Chicken nanban>>>>

Love their matcha baked goods and their chocolate chip cookies ğŸª ğŸ˜‹ mmmmmm!!! Haven't tried their matcha yet, but I'm really loving the chai they serve-- very flavorful and not sweet. They have a nice backyard seating area. Beware it does get really busy here on weekend mornings, but always make this a priority if I'm close enough lol
Absolutely love Acre. Great spot for solo lunch or meeting with friends! Beautiful space, too. A little pricey but worth it, IMO! Perfect little treat.

Love this place with all my heart, donâ€™t stop coming here to try all their menu but please remember itâ€™s fine to leave a LOW TIP (2-3$) in a place thatâ€™s self serviced â€” they are not  serving you; you are going to take your own food, then place it in the trash, no one is going to care and sometimes they wonâ€™t even look at you in the eyes!

Recently I went into a restaurant where I passed by. Itâ€™s a bento restaurant run by Japanese. I always go to Japanese restaurants run by Japanese. Atmosphere and interior design of the restaurant is stylish. They use two elements for Interior design, itâ€™s combining New York industrial style with natural wood. The wood material and color soften the style of steel. Outdoors dining is a fantastic choice, itâ€™s very comfortable when the weather is good. I like the open kitchen and self-service. The pickled radish in the bento is delicious, and the Japanese fried chicken is tender and soft, which goes well with purple rice. However, the brussels sprouts are a bit too hard and too salty. As for salads, they have never been my favorite. You can also purchase high-quality made in Japan organic matcha powder for tea ceremonies use and other high quality items import from Japan. I will definitely come back.
Barista was so rude

Pretty good food. But $23 for a bento box, plus you order at a counter with a cashier they give you a pager to pick up your food at another counter and then slide the iPad back asking about a tip. Maybe itâ€™s just a pet peeve of mine but in this situations Iâ€™d hope the tip is included in the pricing of the food.

@lydieats When youâ€™re in a low appetite mood, a Japanese bento is the right fix ğŸ™†â€â™€ï¸ Balanced, not too heavy, and a nice variety of eats. Acre does it so well, serving satisfying meals in a super welcoming, cozy space. Lots of natural light, with both indoor and outdoor seating, and that effortless Brooklyn charm â˜ºï¸ They also sell rly cute home goods too. For the bentos, the sides are all the same with well seasoned protein, rice, salad, pickled radish, and charred brussel sprouts! Youâ€™ll find me here as soon as the weather warms up.

ğŸ’• salmon saikyo-miso bento box $24*
ğŸ’• chicken nanban bento box $23*

Acreê°€ ì´ê±¸ ì°¸ ì˜í•˜ëŠ”ë° ë§›ë„ ì¢‹ê³  ë¨¹ì„ìˆ˜ ìˆëŠ” ê³µê°„ë„ ë„“ì–´ì„œ í¸í•˜ë‹¤. ì‹¤ë‚´ì™¸ ìë¦¬ ë‘˜ë‹¤ ìˆì–´ì„œ êµ³ ğŸ‘ ë²¤í† ëŠ” ë©”ì¸ë§Œ ë°”ë€Œê³  ë‚˜ë¨¸ì§€ êµ¬ì„±ì€ ê°™ìŒ!

Cute bento boxes and the chicken was incredible. Juicy, flavorful. Not heavy at all and the mayo / sauce was great balance. Order at the front and seating behind the curtain. Just wish there was A/C and the indoor seating wasnâ€™t so cramped and loud.

Cute place! All of the items that they sell is also cute but quite expensive. But their food is so good! We parked our stroller on the back so we will not be in the way since we sat at the front. Ordered tonkatsu bento, chicken karaage bento. Chicken Namban Bento. Chicken fingers with fries for the kids. First come first serve basis for the table. Order first then seat on the table

8/25/23 During waiting for street parking to be available. I finally, stopped by to have lunch at ACRE. I wasn't super hungry, so I choose salmon bento box. I was surprised that this place is self-service and so follow the trend. For self-service price, the price should be cheaper. The ambiance is great, very Japanese garden style. I was glad I went early the day because when I passed by before, this place always packed and crowded but this time it wasn't busy at all. You order food and drink at the counter and pay then they give you an alarm to notify you when your food is ready then you go pick it up by yourself and bring it back to your seat. This place looks like a cafe style more that restaurant. You can bring your laptop or any work to work there as long as you want. By the way food taste good and the quality is amazing.

review on 1/4/23
I just want to check out this restaurant, their menu is interesting, but I only have half hour left on my break, plus they close early so I don't have a chance to eat here. So I decided to just get a Cappuccino here.

While I'm waiting, I walk around a small cafe area seeing nice stuff they sell. The coffee taste nice and I will find the time to come back to eat at this place.

This spot has bento boxes to die for. The food was so incredible that we visited twice during our stay in NYC. We tried the salmon bento and chicken nanban bento, and weâ€™re still dreaming about their flavors. The food isn't the only highlight; they also sell beautiful cups and other charming items. Plus, the staff are exceptionally nice. If youâ€™re searching for a place with delicious meals, definitely give this place a try. Itâ€™s worth every penny!

Love their aesthetics! Full of Japanese goods will welcome you. They have spacious dining space and backyard where you can access after order your food in the front.

We had Chicken Nanban Bento Box, Pesto Avocado Sandwich, and Japanese Fried Chicken Karaage. Chicken Nanban is known as Miyazaki Style chicken dish. Fried chicken soaked in sweet vinegar and soy sauce based sauce. Then, they put creamy tartar sauce on the top. Chicken Nanban tastes fresh and crispy. The bento was served with purple rice, salad, Brussels sprouts, and pickled daikon. Pesto avocado sandwich was little citrus and full of fresh greens. They put smashed avocado, dill, basil pesto, and mozzarella cheese. I like citrus and herbs so I loved it so much. Chicken Karaage was also amazing. All food is made to order which made those Karaage so crispy and juicy. On the menu description, they said they put shoyu koji mayonnaise on the top. To me, the sauce had strong mustard flavor.

Their food feels very healthy and thoughtful. Even the side dishes on the bento had all its role and balance. A lot of gluten free options and some vegetarian options available. My stomach felt really comfortable after consuming their food. I see that their main purpose is to serve fresh, healthy yet hearty food. It is trustworthy to see them pursuing their goal here.

Definitely going back to Acre with lots of love!

This place is delicious and has a super cute patio in the back. It was a little bit tricky with the stroller, but was able to find a good spot not in the way. I had a glass of sparkling wine, a miso soup, and the egg salad. It was the perfect lunch. They also have a little shop up front of Japanese goods which is super cute.

You order at the front in the shop and then get a buzzer for collecting your food when itâ€™s ready.

Will definitely be back.

A nice dining room with cute backyard. No table serive for lunch which gives it a nice casual feel.  Some drainage issues in the year yard made some tables inaccessible.  Bento boxes were a perfect lunch that left us full, but not stuffed.  Fried chicken was crispy juicy.  I questioned tipping it with egg salad, but in the, I was quite happy.  Would be 5 stars if it was more competitively priced.

This is a Japanese Bento Box specialty restaurant.  You order at the counter and they give you a buzzer to come pick up your food.  Self seating.   Outdoor seating.   They do Coffee,  Tea,  baked goods, desserts, and Alcohol here.   Food is good.  Small portions.  On the expensive side so bring your credit cards.   Nice looking restaurant.  Garden seating in the back which is nice.   Staff is nice,  but they're there really for food preparation not table service.  You have to clean up after yourself.   Like a Japanese Chipotle ğŸ˜†.   We will definitely be going back.
Wonderful Japanese foodâ€”lots of bento box choices.  Karange chicken is my go to but many more choices look equally appealing

Very mediocre food at high prices. I had the fried chicken karage (3/5), the French fries (3/5) and the matcha/vanilla cake (you guessed it... 3/5) and everything cost me around $35. Also their system is weird - you need to order then you can sit down. There also isn't an easy place to get utensils or napkins.

Karage bento box (3/5)- they gave me 4 pieces of chicken. Half of them were moist and had a crispy coating. The other two (which I think were old) were dry, and the batter was tough and difficult to eat. The rice however (4/5) was yummy - fluffy, moist, and tender. The 4 tiny pieces of diakon they gave me (5/5) were super flavorful: floral, tangy, and sweet.

French fries (3/5) - some of the fries were hard and while the seasoning was nice it was SUPER salty. I couldn't finish it.

Matcha vanilla cake (3/5) - the matcha part was Dry. The vanilla part (4/5) was nice and moist.

Girlfriend and I came for lunch. It had stellar reviews as well as a very high price point so I had high expectations.

The food was honestly pretty good. I got Karrage while she got Chicken Nanban. Both were very juicy and fresh. I am really not a sauce guy but the sauce was not overwhelming at all. The rice was a bit bland? For some reason I expected more flavor since it was a little colorful. The Brussel sprouts and vegetables/salad were decent, vibrant and refreshing.

I was skeptical at the value but we honestly got pretty full. For reference ~23 dollars per bento set. I got exactly full and she couldn't even finish a little of her meal. I have to say though, this definitely would not do the job for someone who has an above average appetite so take that into consideration. (We eat less).

My only issues were that the price was a bit high for, like others said, self service. For reference, it's similar to the situation in the KTOWN food court with the beeping devices.  What I'm not understanding, on top of why the prices are high for self service, is why we can't sit in/dine in after ordering a online pickup order if there's no substantial indoor service for customers.

The outside area was pretty cool and the bathroom was also really aesthetic, clean and sanitary. The front area also has a lot of cool antiques/items that add a nice touch.

I would like to give a solid 4.5 stars but that's not an option; Definitely not 5 stars unfortunately.

ACRE is definitely a hidden gem with a great selection of high quality ingredients from Japan. There is currently outdoor seating available.

The options on the menu were limited and we had 2 out of the 3 bento box choices: Pork Katsu Bento Box & Chicken Karaage Bento Box. The wait was about 15 minutes for preparing them freshly.

The bento was delicate and delicious but itâ€™s pricey with its portion. Both pork and karaage were fried properly with perfect layer, super juicy and flavorful.

Their pastries look so appetizing, especially the croissant and we would like to try it next time. The business hours were kind of confusing for us because they are open 8am - 4pm daily but also serve take-out & delivery dinner after 4pm.

Aprâ€™25: Gluten free Chicken Karaage was super juicy!

Febâ€™25:Decaf americano a bit sour, but good dining atmosphere and egg sando as a rec!

I had high expectation at ACRE. Atmosphere was great and It was so nice place. Staffs were kinds and cool. The only thing was foods was my pretty much ok. Menu was very limited and mostly chickens. Fish option was only salmon also.

Wow this place was delicious! Tbh for some reason places like this feel â€œvibeyâ€ and donâ€™t really dedicate that much to their food, HOWEVER, I was proven absolutely wrong. This was delicious.

We ordered the Garden Salad & Chicken Karaage Sandwich. I would highly recommend both. The dressing & ingredients with the salad were delicious and super fresh. The sandwich was perfect, chicken fried nicely and had a great sauce-slaw-chicken ratio.

The stuff inside is beautiful, albeit a bit pricy. You might be able to find similar goods at Korin in tribeca.

Iâ€™ve always loved ACRE. They seriously have one of the best French fries I have had in my life, the perfect crisp with the delicious yet subtle nori on top! And the tamogo sandwiches is also classic! They are very creative in innovation of classic believed Japanese cafe food.

The dining experience at ACRE Japanese restaurant presented a series of disappointments, particularly considering the pricing of the menu items in relation to their quality. Expectations set by enticing photos fell significantly short during the visit, leaving a distinct feeling of dissatisfaction.

Commencing with the Karage Bites, the ratio of breading to chicken was notably imbalanced, leaning towards an excess of breading that compromised the essence of the chicken itself. Priced at $14, the dish failed to justify its value, lacking the expected harmony of flavors.

The Chicken Karage Sandwich, devoid of any sauce and comprising solely chicken and coleslaw, contradicted the anticipated presentation from the visuals seen beforehand. At $15, the lack of accompanying sauce contributed to a drier experience, undermining the perceived value.

The Egg Salad Sandwich, accompanied by seemingly uncooked bacon pieces, amounted to a regrettable disappointment considering its $18 price tag. Failing to satisfy the palate, the sandwich lacked the expected richness and fell short of the basic standards for an egg salad sandwich.

The Pesto Avocado Sandwich, priced at $14, represented a culmination of bitter and somewhat sour flavors, lacking in true essence and not justifying its cost.

Moving to the Garden Salad, advertised to include quinoa, but disappointingly only offering a minuscule amount that didn't align with the expectations set by its $16 price point, left a dissatisfying impression.

The Salmon Bento Box, priced at $25, presented a meager portion of just two small pieces of salmon alongside rice and salad, failing to meet the standards of value and leaving a sense of disrespect towards patrons.

While the Chicken Curry showcased flavorful chicken and sauce, the $21 price tag (excluding the unprovided extra rice) did not fully align with the overall value of the dish.

The Scallion Parmesan Scone, although an interesting pairing concept, failed to deliver a delightful taste experience. Similarly, the Ham and Cheese Croissant, though improved after being air fried, did not justify its $7 cost.

Among the desserts, the Matcha Cake offered subtle yet enjoyable flavors, potentially warranting a repeat order, while the Vanilla Cake, regrettably dry and exhibiting an unappealing oiliness, failed to meet expectations.

Overall, the visit to ACRE Japanese restaurant was characterized by a pervasive sense of disappointment stemming from the underwhelming taste profiles and mismatched value propositions of most menu items. Given the high pricing coupled with the lackluster culinary offerings, this venture did not merit the investment in either time or money. Given the choice, it would not be a preferred dining destination in the future.

One of my favorite lunch spots. Great ambiance, service, and eats. We stopped in for lunch on a Saturday afternoon and while there was a bit of a line, it moved relatively quickly.

We got the Fried Chicken and Vegetable Bento Boxes. Both were great. The fried chicken and potato bites both had a crispy exterior and the chicken was still juicy on the inside. The Brussel Sprouts in particular were well-seasoned and scrumptious. I wish they served more of them with the boxes.

Cute place with tasty and wholesome bento boxes. Happened to be just around the corner from me but I would have journeyed even a bit further to come here again for the food, relaxed atmosphere and maybe to buy some of the beautiful Japanese ceramics next time. Highly recommend the matcha latte, salmon bento and the chocolate chip cookie was a delicious close. Will be back!
Not a huge menu or a ton of selection but the avocado pesto sandwich was warm and had a good amount of cheese and pesto, and quite warm! The miso soup is fantastic and has lots of good veggies!
Wonderful egg salad sandwich and chicken karaage at this Japanese cafe in Brooklyn. Very modern cool Japanese interior. Quiet noise. Relaxed.

Great food selection of bento boxes and sandos. Great quality and taste.

Love the ceramics and Japanese home goods store in the front.

I got the chicken nanban bento box. You order at the front section of the place and then get a buzzer to wait. Thereâ€™s a pretty big back section with an enclosed backyard. The chicken was good, I like the sauce on it. Everything else (saladâ€¦

This is another delightful Japanese restaurant. I was recommended this place because they offer "authentic bento box, not just salmon teriyaki stuff".

I had the fried chicken bento box and it was delicious. Delicious and tasty, two pieces were dark meat, two were white meat, and all of it was delicious. The rest of the menu looked very tasty too.

The space itself is huge! Plus there's garden seating in back, the front is a cafe and store. A true gem in Greenpoint

such a lovely environment. as you walk in you can shop for ceramics and japanese goods. they sell fresh in house pastries and foods. price is little inflated but the quality and taste is very pleasing. they have plenty of indoor and outdoor seating. bathrooms are really nice and clean. staff is very kind and attentive!

A local Japanese goods shop & bento box place. This place is nice for a quick bite and takeouts. Can get pretty busy on weekends.
I like their bento boxes - tasty and pretty healthy. Not anything super special or intricate but straight forward. Would recommend the salmon bento box and the chicken nanban bento box.
If you're planning on dining in, keep in mind the dining area is more of a self-serve food court experience.
